SENT.plain: Report on a case of Tangier disease in a girl aged 4.11 m
Clinically the tonsils were hypertrophic and of a yellow color
Their stroma contained many cholesterinesters which produced the histologic picture of foam-cell xanthomatosis
The serum contained only traces of alpha-lipoprotein
The level of Cholesterin of the HDL fraction was reduced to one twelvth of the norm
The serum of her father also showed a clearly reduced content of HDL cholesterin
In the patient herself lipolytic enzymes like lecithin-cholesterin-acyltransferase, post-heparin plasma-lipoprotein lipase and hepatic triglycerid-lipase showed normal activity
